title: Refactor audit logs to add user-specific metadata fields
summary: Update audit log schemas and systems to include additional metadata fields that directly map each log entry to a specific user, improving traceability and enabling finer-grained GDPR compliance for personal data identification.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: comprehensive user-mapping via new metadata fields

title: Classify log entries as personal or operational data per GDPR v2
summary: Develop mechanisms to automatically classify each audit log entry as either personal or operational data, enabling regulatory filtering and correct application of deletion or retention rules under GDPR v2.

title: Implement data lineage tracking for log downstream dependencies
summary: Introduce tools and schema extensions to enable tracing of each log entry’s downstream usage, supporting understanding of how log data propagates through systems and strengthening traceability for compliance and RtE operations.

title: Trigger automated RtE workflow upon user deletion request
summary: Implement automation that initiates the right-to-erasure workflow when a user requests deletion, orchestrating relevant log entry identification, review, and action according to compliance protocols.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Trigger automated RtE workflow upon user deletion

title: Support full deletion of eligible personal data in logs
summary: Ensure the audit log platform can securely identify and permanently delete all eligible personal user data from logs, in alignment with GDPR right-to-erasure mandates and organizational retention policies.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: full deletion of eligible personal data in logs

title: Enable partial deletion/redaction in situations impacting auditability
summary: Provide mechanisms for redacting or partially deleting specific fields in log entries to balance privacy requirements with audit and legal obligations, especially when full deletion could compromise auditability.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: partial deletion/redaction in situations impacting auditability

title: Log all RtE actions in meta-logs with reason codes, requestor ID, and timestamps
summary: Ensure every right-to-erasure related action is recorded in a meta-log containing reason codes, requestor identifiers, and time details, thus supporting post-deletion audits and regulatory traceability.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: All deletion/redaction actions must be logged with detailed meta-logs

title: Handle field-level redaction for composite log entries involving multiple users
summary: Design logic and controls to enable redaction or deletion of personal data fields only for affected users in multi-user log entries, preserving necessary data for uninvolved parties and maintaining integrity.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: composite log entries involving multiple users

title: Restrict access with role-based controls when legal retention precludes deletion
summary: Develop and enforce role-based access controls for log entries that must be retained by law, preventing unauthorized access to data that cannot be deleted but must remain protected for compliance reasons.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: legal retention exceptions, enforce access controls

title: Ensure all deletion/redaction operations are tamper-evident using cryptographic checksums and hash chaining
summary: Implement cryptographic techniques, including checksums and hash chaining, to validate the integrity of audit logs and deletion/redaction actions, ensuring all changes are tamper-evident and compliant with security requirements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: tamper-evident using cryptographic checksums and hash chaining

title: Provide APIs for compliance team review/approval/denial of deletion/redaction actions
summary: Develop and expose secure APIs that allow the compliance team to review, approve, or deny deletion and redaction actions as part of the right-to-erasure process. These APIs must enforce access controls and record all review decisions for full auditability.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: include APIs for compliance team review/approval, and enforce access controls

title: Implement dashboards and scheduled reports for RtE monitoring and metrics
summary: Build dashboards and enable scheduled reporting to monitor right-to-erasure (RtE) operations and related metrics in real time. These tools support operational and compliance oversight, enabling visibility into system actions and exceptions.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Real-time monitoring, dashboarding, and comprehensive operational reporting are required

title: Log all RtE actions in real-time to a secure, access-controlled meta-log system
summary: Ensure that every right-to-erasure (RtE) action is logged in real time to a secure meta-log system with strict access controls. These meta-logs must be tamper-evident, cryptographically validated, and support audit and compliance requirements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: All deletion/redaction actions must be secure, tamper-evident, and logged with detailed meta-logs, requiring cryptographic validation and hash chaining.
